intro: Faramea panurensis, commonly known as the Panurensis Faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
